poem:
### James May's Reflection

Mistaken for the roar of Clarkson,  
James retreats to self-examine.  
Skydiving shuns him, so too the dance  
of Morris men, robes of a monk.  
He questions the whispers of broccoli,  
unsure where to place it.  
In this quiet introspection,  
a gentle rejection of all things extreme.
